channel.title: Startups on technocracy
channel.description: Recent content in Startups on technocracy

item.title: How Qualytics Builds Product
item.description: It’s been four years since our first product demo at Qualytics and as we’ve developed our eponymous product into an enterprise offering, we’ve refined our process in lockstep. I didn’t build our team around a manifesto but around a shared mission. We started with customer problems and pushed to deliver robust solutions quickly without breaking things (too badly).

item.title: On Data Quality
item.description: At Interos, my team built a platform for assembling and maintaining the world’s business supply chains. That required data. That required a lot of data.

item.title: Social Tables Retrospective
item.description:
My last post was over a year and a half ago - just after I joined an interesting Bessemer Ventures backed firm in the Hospitality sector called Social Tables.
My role here has been 95% people / 5% tech and always intense. I’m retroactively posting some of the internal content I circulated as the technology leader at Social Tables - mostly high-level explanations of what my team was up to at the time.
